com.dukascopy.api
Interface IChart

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<IChartObject>
public interface IChart
extends java.lang.Iterable<IChartObject>

Allows to draw graphical objects on the chart

Nested Class Summary
static class IChart.Type
          Type of the graphical object

          Deprecated. - this method is deprecated. please use addToMainChartUnlocked() method instead. Draws graphical object that requires up to 2 points. Object can be selected, moved and changed by the user

Method Detail

draw

@Deprecated
IChartObject draw(java.lang.String key,
                             IChart.Type type,
                             long time1,
                             double price1,
                             long time2,
                             double price2,
                             long time3,
                             double price3)
Deprecated. - this method is deprecated. please use IChartObjectFactory create() method() instead.

Draws graphical object that requires up to 3 points

Parameters:
key - unique id of the object
type - type of the object
time1 - time of first point
price1 - price of first point
time2 - time of second point
price2 - price of second point
time3 - time of third point
price3 - price of third point
Returns:
graphical object

move

void move(IChartObject objectToMove,
          long newTime,
          double newPrice)
Moves graphical object to new coordinates. Do not initiate chart repaint immediately, use IChart.repaint() method if necessary.

Parameters:
objectToMove - chart object to move
newTime - new time coordinate
newPrice - new price coordinate

move

void move(java.lang.String chartObjectKey,
          long newTime,
          double newPrice)
Moves graphical object to new coordinates. Do not initiate chart repaint immediately, use IChart.repaint() method if necessary.

Parameters:
chartObjectKey - key of the chart object to move
newTime - new time coordinate
newPrice - new price coordinate

comment

void comment(java.lang.String comment)
Writes a comment in the upper left corner. Line is splitted by new line characters

Parameters:
comment - string to display

java.awt.Font getCommentFont()

Returns:

Parameters:
color - the color to become comment's foreground color if this parameter is null, then used default text font defined in chart's theme
See Also:

Returns:
comments's foreground color if comment does not have a foreground color, then used default text font defined in chart's theme

size

int size()
Returns number of the graphical objects on the chart

Returns:
number of the graphical objects on the chart

priceMin

double priceMin(int index)
Returns minimal value of the vertical scale of the specified subwindow of the current chart (0-main chart window, the indicators' subwindows are numbered starting from 1). If the subwindow index has not been specified, the minimal value of the price scale of the main chart window is returned.

Parameters:
index - of the (sub-)window
Returns:
minimal value of the vertical scale

priceMax

double priceMax(int index)
Returns maximal value of the vertical scale of the specified subwindow of the current chart (0-main chart window, the indicators' subwindows are numbered starting from 1). If the subwindow index has not been specified, the maximal value of the price scale of the main chart window is returned.

Parameters:
index - of the (sub-)window
Returns:
maximal value of the vertical scale

setVerticalAxisScale

void setVerticalAxisScale(double minPriceValue,
                          double maxPriceValue)
Sets minimal and maximal value of the vertical scale of the current chart when it is maximally expanded. Note: automatically switches off chart price range autoscaling.

Parameters:
minPriceValue - minimal value of the vertical scale
maxpriceValue - maximal value of the vertical scale

setVerticalAutoscale

void setVerticalAutoscale(boolean autoscale)
Switches on/off chart vertical autoscale mode. When autoscale switched off chart is draggable vertically

Parameters:
autoscale -

Returns amount of bars visible on the screen

Returns:
amount of bars visible on the screen

windowsTotal

int windowsTotal()
Returns count of indicator windows on the chart (including main chart).

Returns:
total count of chart windows (main window + indicator subwindows)

getChartObjectFactory

IChartObjectFactory getChartObjectFactory()
Returns IChartObjectFactory instance. This factory provides convenience methods to create various graphics objects.

Returns:
IChartObjectFactory instance.

addToMainChart

<T extends IChartObject> void addToMainChart(T object)
Adds object of IChartObject super type to main chart window. Please note that only 1 instance of object can be added per main chart window.

Parameters:
object - - instance of IChartObject super type.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if object is already present on any of main charts.

addToSubChart

<T extends IChartObject> void addToSubChart(java.lang.Integer subChartId,
                                            int indicatorId,
                                            T object)
Adds object of IChartObject super type to sub chart window with specified subChartId and indicatorId. Please note that only 1 instance of object can be added per sub chart window.

Parameters:
subChartId - - sub chart id.
indicatorId - - indicator function id.
object - - instance of IChartObject super type.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if object is already present on any of sub charts.

addToMainChartUnlocked

<T extends IChartObject> void addToMainChartUnlocked(T object)
Deprecated. Please, use method @link addToMainChart(IChartObject) There is no objects division onto locked and unlocked anymore

Adds object of IChartObject super type to unlocked objects pool of main chart window. Please note that only 1 instance of object can be added to unlocked objects pool per main chart window.

Parameters:
object - - instance of IChartObject super type.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if object is already present on any of main charts unlocked objects pool.

isChartObjectUnlocked

java.lang.Boolean isChartObjectUnlocked(IChartObject chartObject)
Deprecated. There is no objects division onto locked and unlocked anymore, so this method will always return false

Checks whether chartObject is unlocked or not. Returns null if chart does not contain specified chartObject

Parameters:
chartObject -
Returns:
true - chartObject is unlocked, false - if not, null - chartObject does not belong to this chart.

getTickBarSize

TickBarSize getTickBarSize()
The method returns currently selected Trade Bar Size on Tick Bar chart For non Tick Bar charts null might be returned

Returns:
selected Tick Bar Size

getStrategyChartObjects

java.util.List<IChartObject> getStrategyChartObjects()
The method returns List of chart objects created by current strategy Empty list is returned if no objects were created Null is never returned

Returns:
chart objects that were create by current strategy

getImage

java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
Creates a BufferedImage snapshot of this chart at the given moment.

Returns:
BufferedImage snapshot of current chart at the method invocation moment.
